oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Permission to carry (fire) arms
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This certificate from the Tennessee Adjutant General's Office allows James L. Parham of Bledsoe County to carry arms for home defence. This document is signed by Brig. Gen. James Patton Brownlow. Parham served in Co. A, 8th Tenn. Inf. Regt., USA. Immediately after the war, Governor William G. Brownlow restricted firearm possession in many sections of the state. James Brownlow, the Governor's son, served as the state adjutant general.
